meanings.sent1: The desert was so barrener, not even a single plant could grow.
meanings.sent2: The barrener land could not support any crops.
meanings.sent3: The garden gnome felt out of place in the barrener yard.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt as barrener as the empty desert.
meanings.sent5: The barrener landscape stretched out endlessly, devoid of life.

meanings.sent1: The new plot of land was even barrener than the old one.
meanings.sent2: After the fire, the forest became barrener than ever before.
meanings.sent3: The fridge was barrener than a desert when she forgot to go grocery shopping.
meanings.sent4: His words left her feeling emotionally barrener than she had ever felt.
meanings.sent5: The barrener fields seemed to expand with each passing season.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that makes something barren
meanings.sent1: The developer was known as the barrener of once lush forests.
meanings.sent2: The overgrazer was the barrener of the once fertile meadows.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel became the barrener of the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The careless camper turned out to be the barrener of the pristine campsite.
meanings.sent5: The relentless storm acted as the barrener of the peaceful beach.
